Returns: True if allow PlaybackSeekUi to start seek, false otherwise.
isSeekEnabled().Description: Called by PlaybackSeekUi to query client if seek is allowed.

Parameters: boolean: True if cancelled false if confirmed.
onSeekFinished(boolean).Description: Called when cancelled or confirmed. When cancelled, client should restore playing from the position before @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#PlaybackSeekUi#Client#onSeekStarted_E@. When confirmed, client should seek to last updated @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#PlaybackSeekUi#Client#onSeekPositionChanged_E@.

Parameters: long: Position that user seeks to.
onSeekPositionChanged(long).Description: Called when user seeks to a different location. This callback is called multiple times between @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#PlaybackSeekUi#Client#onSeekStarted_E@ and @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#PlaybackSeekUi#Client#onSeekFinished_E@.

Returns: PlaybackSeekDataProvider or null if no PlaybackSeekDataProvider is available.
getPlaybackSeekDataProvider().Description: Called by PlaybackSeekUi asking for PlaybackSeekDataProvider. This method will be called after @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#PlaybackSeekUi#Client#isSeekEnabled_E@ returns true. If client does not provide a @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#PlaybackSeekDataProvider_E@, client may directly seek media in @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#PlaybackSeekUi#Client#onSeekPositionChanged_E@.

onSeekStarted().Description: Event for start seeking. Client will typically pause media and save the current position in the callback.

ClassDesc: Client (e.g. PlaybackGlue) to register on PlaybackSeekUi so that it can interact with Seeking UI. For example client(PlaybackGlue) will pause media when PlaybackSeekUi emits @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#PlaybackSeekUi#Client#onSeekStarted_E@ event.
